Name: Prince David
Builder:
Cammell Laird & Co., Birkenhead, UK
Conversion to AMC by Halifax Shipyards Limited., Halifax, Nova Scotia
Conversion to LSI(M) by Burrard Dry Dock Ltd., Vancouver, British Columbia
awards:
Atlantic 1941
Aleutians 1942
Aegean 1943–44
Normandy 1944
South France 1944
Installed power:
6 × Yarrow water-tube five-drum super-heat main boilers 
2 × Scottish marine three-burner auxiliary boilers
19,300 ihp (14,392 kW) at 267 rpm.
Propulsion: Twin screw Parsons reaction three-stage single-reduction geared turbines;
Range: 3,500 nmi (6,482 km; 4,028 mi) at 20 knots (37 km/h; 23 mph)
Armament:
4 × 6-inch/45 cal Mk VII guns[1] in 2 single mounts forward and 2 aft (as AMC).
4 × 4-inch Mk XVI HA/LA guns in two twin mounts (as LSI M).
2 × 3-inch HA guns in two single mounts (as AMC).
2 × 40-mm Bofors guns (as LSI M).
several Vickers .303 twin MGs.
10 × Oerlikon 20 mm cannon Mk 5 in single mounts after Apr.20/42 refit.
2 stern-mounted depth charge chutes for Mk. VIII 300 lb.canister depth charges (as AMC).
